title: Attitudinals & Tense Narrative
goal: Tell a vivid story with emotion and precise time.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Connectives review:

.e = ?
gi'e = ?
joi = ?

(Answers: sumti and, bridi-tail and, together as mass)

Review Material (5-7 min)

Attitudinals

Cmavo Emotion
.ui Happy
.oi Pain/complaint
.uu Pity/sympathy
.ie Agreement
.ua Discovery
.a'o Hope
.au Desire

Intensity

Suffix Level
sai Strong
cu'i Neutral
nai Opposite 
.ui sai = very happy
.ui nai = unhappy

Tense System

Time Aspect Duration
pu/ca/ba co'a/ca'o/mo'u/co'u ze'i/ze'a/ze'u

Compound Tenses

puca'o = was ongoing
baco'a = will begin
puze'u = for long time (past)

Sticky Tense

mi pu ki klama .i citka .i sipna

(In the past:) I went. Ate. Slept.

Repetition

reroi = twice
so'iroi = many times

Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise: Write an Emotional Narrative

Write a 10-sentence story that includes:

  • At least 3 different attitudinals
  • Compound tenses (puca'o, baco'a, etc.)
  • Sticky tense (ki)
  • Sequential connectives (.i ba bo)
Example Answer 
.i pu ki lo solri cu co'a carmi
.i ba bo mi cikna
.i .ui sai mi gleki
.i ba bo mi klama bartu
.i puca'o cadzu bu'u lo foldi
.i .ua mi viska lo melbi cipni
.i .oi ku'i mi farlu
.i mi se cortu
.i .uu mi tatpi
.i ba bo mi xruti lo zdani
.i ca ki mi surla gi'e sipna
.i .a'o lo bavla djedi cu xamgu

(Past: The sun started shining. Then I woke up. Very happy, I was glad! Then I went outside. I was walking in the field. Aha, I saw a beautiful bird! But ouch, I fell. I was hurt. Alas, I was tired. Then I returned home. Now: I rest and sleep. Hopefully tomorrow will be good.)

Challenge (1-2 min)

Read your narrative aloud with appropriate emotion.

Check:

  • Natural attitudinal placement
  • Consistent tense
  • Clear emotional arc

Today's Review

Emotion and time tools:

Tool Function
Attitudinals .ui, .oi, .uu, etc.
Intensity sai, cu'i, nai
Compound tense puca'o, baco'a, etc.
Sticky tense ki
Sequence .i ba bo, .i pu bo
Repetition paroi, reroi, so'iroi

Summary

You practiced creating vivid narratives with emotion markers and precise tense.

Tomorrow preview: Free composition — demonstrate full fluency.
